Don’t Argue! Review | Bon Appetit








































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginvancouverDon’t Argue!Very good pizza and people-watching at this casual Mount Pleasant jointFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailGrant HarderGO HERE: for pizza made with otherworldly dough, which more closely resembles New York’s crispy-yet-tender pies than Naples' blistered, chewy crusts. Don't Argue! is so cool you’re unlikely to get served with a smile, but it’s worth it for the pie, available either whole or by the slice.ORDER THE: pesto ricotta pizza, which has the perfect crust for sopping up leftover olive oil on the pan. The sausage-kale is a stellar red-sauce option, while the pancetta-pineapple is a must for OG Hawaiian pizza fans.THE VIBE IS: relaxed, with flour-dusted hipsters behind the counter and plenty of chill neighborhood regulars at the tables. If you can, grab a coveted spot on the tiny front patio and watch the eclectic Main Street crowds pass by.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day: Monday to Friday, from 3 p.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturday, from 1 p.m. to 11 p.m.; and Sunday, from 1 p.m. to 10 p.m.—Lindsay AndersonGrant HarderGrant HarderExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
